recommendation: On 27 April 2017 the Commission recommended that the Director of Maritime New Zealand draw surveyors' and vessel ownersâ€™ attention to the benefits of installing safety mechanisms designed to alert crew to any abnormal rises in water levels in compartments, particularly those compartments that compromise the reserve buoyancy or stability of fishing vessels.

On 27 April 2017 the Commission recommended that the Director of Maritime New Zealand work with surveyors and designers of fishing vessels to ensure that fishing vessels have effective means of escape from all compartments for all reasonably foreseeable emergency situations.
